You must give way to oncoming traffic.
questions.qn: You are facing traffic lights (as shown). What do they mean?

options: Stop, wait behind the stop line until the lights change to green.
Stop, wait behind the stop line until the lights change to yellow.
Stop, make sure there is no traffic, then drive straight ahead.
questions.qn: At traffic lights what is meant when a red light appears?

options: Stop, only if a red light camera is in use
Speed up to clear the intersection before the lights change to red.
Stop at the stop line unless you are so close that sudden or sharp braking might cause an accident.
questions.qn: What should you do when approaching traffic lights which change from green to yellow?

options: You should slow down and check if anyone is coming before turning left.
- If the lights are red you must first stop, then you may turn left if it is safe to do so.
You may turn left only if a green arrow is shown
questions.qn: What may you do at an intersection with traffic lights at which this sign is displayed?

options: Yes, if there is no danger of colliding with another vehicle.
Yes, at all times
No, unless there is a U-TURN PERMITTED sign at the intersection
questions.qn: Are you permitted to make a U-Turn at traffic lights?

options: Can turn left, but not go straight ahead.
Can turn left or go straight ahead.
Can turn left only if a sign 'TURN LEFT AT ANY TIME WITH CARE' is displayed.
questions.qn: These lights mean that you -

options: Can make a U turn provided it is safe to do so.
Can go straight ahead, or turn left or turn right, if it is safe to do so.
Must stop and wait for the red light before proceeding.
questions.qn: This light means, you -

options: Not turn right while the arrow is red
Turn right when you have waited one minute
Turn right if it is safe to do so.
questions.qn: It is 3 o'clock in the morning. You cannot see any other traffic. You want to turn right. You may -

options: Sound your horn and proceed through the red light.
Speed up to avoid traffic from the left and right.
Stop and wait for the green light
questions.qn: As you approach an intersection with traffic lights, the yellow light turns to red. You must

options: Slow down and turn left or right if it is safe.
Stop and turn left only if it is safe.
Stop and wait for a green light.
questions.qn: You approach an intersection showing a red light and the sign shown. You wish to turn left. You must -

options: Stop
Keep going
Drive through and sound your horn.
questions.qn: It is early morning and there is no other traffic about. You approach an intersection when the traffic lights change from green to yellow. What should you do?

options: Check both sides of the intersection and then proceed.
Cross the intersection as quickly as possible.
Wait until the traffic behind you makes you move.
questions.qn: You are waiting at an intersection and the lights are red. The traffic lights change to green. You should -

options: Enter the intersection and wait for the green arrow
Move forward slowly.
Stay behind the stop line until the green arrow shows.
questions.qn: You want to turn right at an intersection and see this traffic light. You should

options: Stop until the light turns green.
Stop, then if you see it is safe turn left
Stop then go straight ahead.
questions.qn: You wish to turn left at this intersection. The traffic lights are red and you see this sign. You should -

options: Wait behind the stop line until there is room for you to enter the new road.
Move forward slowly, make the left turn and wait behind car A.
Enter the intersection and sound the horn.
questions.qn: You wish to turn left at this intersection and the traffic lights are green. What should you do?

options: Accelerate to clear the intersection before the lights change to red.
Drive through the intersection without accelerating.
Stop before the lights, unless you are so close that sudden braking might cause an accident.
questions.qn: As you approach a set of traffic lights at an intersection, they change from green to yellow (amber). You must -

options: Apply to road works vehicles only
Must be obeyed.
Are installed to warn motorists of construction works.
questions.qn: Temporary traffic lights at road works -

options: After the traffic lights, but before the construction zone.
Where the lane ends.
At the 'Stop here on red signal' sign.
questions.qn: Where do you stop at temporary traffic lights?

options: You may proceed only in the direction of the green arrow when the red light has changed to green.
You may proceed only in the direction of the green arrow.
You must give way to oncoming traffic.

options: Stop, wait behind the stop line until the lights change to green.
Stop, wait behind the stop line until the lights change to yellow.
Stop, make sure there is no traffic, then drive straight ahead.
